decks.notes: This UR Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and disruption to quickly overwhelm opponents. Using cards such as Dragon's Rage Channeler and Cori-Steel Cutter, the deck aims to apply pressure while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Lightning Bolt provides additional removal or reach to close out games. The deck also includes card selection and filtering tools like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers.

The primary objective of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat out powerful, game-winning creatures, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, using the combo card Show and Tell. By utilizing cards like Omniscience and LÃ³rien Revealed, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-impact threats before they have a chance to react. Through careful planning and resource management, the deck strives to win the game as quickly as possible, leveraging its powerful combo pieces and disruptive spells like Force of Will to ensure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to lock down the opponent's mana base using cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while quickly ramping up to play powerful threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide to do this efficiently. Additionally, the deck can close out games quickly with cards like The One Ring and Shatterskull Smashing. Overall, the strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and overwhelm them with aggressive plays.

This Legacy combo deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, then using cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to find and play powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony for a game-winning storm combo. The deck also uses cards like Brainstorm and Wishclaw Talisman to dig for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and Veil of Summer. The deck has a diverse mana base to support its various colors and can easily tutor for specific lands through cards like Urza's Saga.

The deck focuses on utilizing Cloudpost lands and ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog and Emrakul. The primary strategy involves using cards like Expedition Map to search for Cloudposts, Glimmerposts, and Urza's Tower to accelerate mana production, while also controlling the board with counterspells like Force of Negation and disruption such as Disruptor Flute. The inclusion of cards like Dress Down and Stock Up provide additional utility and card advantage, while the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad offers a versatile companion option for the deck.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro - Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also focuses on taxing the opponent's resources with cards like Containment Priest and White Orchid Phantom. Finally, the deck aims to close out the game quickly with aggressive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Orcish Bowmasters, backed up by powerful threats like Overlord of the Balemurk.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures while using powerful support cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt their game plan. The deck aims to utilize mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to cast big threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer ahead of schedule. Additionally, cards like Wasteland and Wastescape+Battlemage','','');">Wastescape Battlemage are included to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin help to reduce the cost of casting Eldrazi creatures, further enabling the aggressive strategy.

This deck aims to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's mana base using cards like Magus of the Moon and Chalice of the Void. By playing aggressively and utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Broadside Bombardiers. The inclusion of cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption provide additional removal options and ways to close out the game efficiently. The strategy revolves around leveraging early game aggression and disruptive elements to secure victory.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to establish control over the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy through cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also managing resources with counter spells like Force of Will. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thundertrap Trainer provide card advantage and board control, while Orcish Bowmasters and Flame of Anor offer removal options. The deck also includes a mix of land destruction (Wasteland) and card selection (Brainstorm, Ponder) to ensure consistency and adaptability in different matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Sneak Attack or Show and Tell. The strategy revolves around getting these big creatures into play as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have time to react. The deck also includes a number of counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo pieces and ensure its success.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's strategies while deploying threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck utilizes a mix of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares, along with creatures like Solitude and Flickerwisp to control the board. Additionally, the deck includes efficient beaters like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Dauthi Voidwalker to apply pressure. The deck also benefits from the synergy between creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Witch Enchanter, creating a versatile and adaptable strategy to outmaneuver opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Mystic Forge to power out a variety of artifacts that lead to a powerful combo. By generating mana with artifacts like Grim Monolith and Basalt Monolith, players can play multiple spells in a single turn, potentially leading to a game-winning sequence of plays. Tezzeret, Karn, and other key cards provide additional support and utility to the combo strategy, while Urza's lands and artifacts help to ramp up quickly and efficiently. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment, Cabal Therapy, and Swords to Plowshares, you can control the board while dealing consistent damage. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide powerful boosts to your creatures, while Guide of Souls and Voice of Victory offer additional support. With a strong mana base including Wasteland and Karakas, this deck aims to maintain pressure and disrupt your opponent's strategy to secure the win.

The main focus of this combo Doomsday deck is to quickly assemble and cast the Doomsday spell, stacking the deck in a specific order to win the game on the following turn. Utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Personal Tutor, and Thoughtseize to set up the perfect Doomsday pile, the deck aims to win through alternate win conditions such as Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. With access to disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will, the deck can protect its combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to control the opponent's resources, and cards like Fatal Push, Murktide Regent, and Nethergoyf to apply pressure, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure a victory through tempo advantage. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower provide additional versatility in dealing with various threats, while the deck's mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and disruption through cards like Wasteland.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to generate a large storm count and then win the game with a high-powered Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize while generating mana efficiently with cards like Chrome Mox and Dark Ritual. Wishclaw Talisman is used to tutor for key combo pieces, while cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish provide additional ways to search for win conditions. Overall, the deck relies on fast mana and efficient card selection to execute its combo strategy.
